summary: This is an email from attorney Marc A. Weinstein to Andrew Tomback, transmitting documents in response to a grand jury subpoena for prior wills of Jeffrey Epstein. The attached documents (Bates numbers GJ_000103 through GJ_000197) are being produced by the executors of Epstein's estate.

persons.name: Marc A. Weinstein
persons.role: Partner and Chair of White Collar Defense at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP
persons.context: Attorney sending the email and attached documents in response to a grand jury subpoena regarding Jeffrey Epstein's prior wills.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.role: Recipient of the email (likely a prosecutor or government attorney)
persons.context: The email is addressed to him, and he made the request for Jeffrey Epstein's prior wills pursuant to grand jury subpoenas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased individual whose estate is the subject of the subpoena
persons.context: The grand jury subpoena seeks prior wills belonging to him, and the documents are being produced by the executors of his estate.

connections.description: Weinstein is sending a formal legal response (documents) to Tomback in compliance with a grand jury subpoena.
Weinstein's firm appears to be representing or acting for the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate in responding to the grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoenas Issued
events.description: Grand jury subpoenas were issued to the executors of the estate of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Production of Epstein's Prior Wills
events.description: Attorney Marc A. Weinstein transmits documents (Bates GJ_000103 through GJ_000197) in response to the grand jury subpoena for any prior wills of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: One Battery Park Plaza, 17th floor (Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP office)
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on October 18, 2019, to the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, seeking his prior wills.
On January 16, 2020, attorney Marc A. Weinstein produced documents (Bates GJ_000103 through GJ_000197) in response to that subpoena.
The production indicates an ongoing grand jury investigation related to Jeffrey Epstein's estate and finances after his death.
The law firm Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP is involved in representing the estate's executors in this matter.
